# eatATA

# eatATA

## Overview

`eatATA` provides a small `R` interface to mathematical optimization
solvers specialized on solving simple automated test assembly problems
(`ATA`). Internally, sparse matrices are used via the `Matrix` package.
Currently supported solvers are `GLPK`, `lpSolve`, `Symphony`, and
`Gurobi`. See below for a list of implemented features and feature to
come.

## Installation

``` r
# Install eatATA from CRAN via
install.packages("eatATA")

# Install development version from GitHub via
remotes::install_github("beckerbenj/eatATA", build_vignettes = TRUE, dependencies = TRUE)
```

## Documentation

An extensive tutorial paper including a variety of use cases has been
published here: <https://doi.org/10.3390/psych3020010>. Additionally, a
set of vignettes describing the current functionality can be found on
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=eatATA/).

## Implemented Features

`eatATA` is suitable for the automated test assembly of fixed linear
test forms or multi-stage testing modules. For example, the following
types of constraints can be set via `eatATA`:

- no item overlap between test forms

- complete item pool depletion

- categorical and numerical constraints across test forms

- excluding items from being together in the same booklet (item
  exclusions)

- force items to be in the same test form (item inclusions)

- force a set of items to be included in the test forms

- various optimization constraints

## Outlook

Features that might be implemented in the future:

- taking into account hierarchical stimulus-item structures

- adopting the `ROI` framework to access a larger number of solvers

If you wish to contribute to the package, please send an email to
<b.becker@iqb.hu-berlin.de>.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`acrossFormsConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/acrossFormsConstraint.md)
  : Constrain the sum of item values across multiple forms.

- [`analyzeBlockExclusion()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/analyzeBlockExclusion.md)
  : Analyze block exclusiveness

- [`analyzeComplexBlockExclusion()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/analyzeComplexBlockExclusion.md)
  : Analyze complex block exclusiveness

- [`appendSolution()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/appendSolution.md)
  :

  Append a `useSolver` output

- [`autoItemValuesMinMaxConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/autoItemValuesMinMaxConstraint.md)
  : Create single value constraints with minimum and maximum.

- [`calculateIIF()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/calculateIIF.md)
  : Calculate Item Information Function

- [`cappedMaximinObjective()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/cappedMaximinObjective.md)
  : Capped Maximin Constraint.

- [`combineConstraints()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/combineConstraints.md)
  : Combine constraints

- [`computeTargetValues()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/computeTargetValues.md)
  : Compute target values based on the item pool.

- [`depletePoolConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/depletePoolConstraint.md)
  : Use complete item pool.

- [`dummiesToFactor()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/dummiesToFactor.md)
  : Convert dummy variables to factor.

- [`getMean3PLN()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/getMean3PLN.md)
  [`getMean2PLN()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/getMean3PLN.md)
  [`getVar3PLN()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/getMean3PLN.md)
  [`getVar2PLN()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/getMean3PLN.md)
  : Calculate Cumulants Lognormal Response Time Distribution

- [`calculateExpectedRT()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/get_mean_3PLN.md)
  [`calculateExpectedRTvar()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/get_mean_3PLN.md)
  : Calculate Cumulants Lognormal Response Time Distribution

- [`inspectSolution()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/inspectSolution.md)
  :

  Inspect a `useSolver` output

- [`itemCategoryConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemCategoryConstraint.md)
  : Create item category constraints.

- [`itemCategoryRangeConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemCategoryRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemCategoryMinConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemCategoryRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemCategoryMaxConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemCategoryRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemCategoryDeviationConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemCategoryRangeConstraint.md)
  : Create item category constraints with minimum and maximum.

- [`itemExclusionConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemExclusionConstraint.md)
  [`itemInclusionConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemExclusionConstraint.md)
  : Create item inclusion or exclusion constraints.

- [`itemTuples()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemTuples.md)
  : Create item tuples.

- [`itemUsageConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemUsageConstraint.md)
  : Create item usage constraints.

- [`itemValuesConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemValuesConstraint.md)
  : Constrain the sum of item values per form.

- [`itemValuesRangeConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemValuesRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemValuesMinConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemValuesRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemValuesMaxConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemValuesRangeConstraint.md)
  [`itemValuesDeviationConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemValuesRangeConstraint.md)
  : Create single value constraints with minimum and maximum.

- [`itemsPerFormConstraint()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/itemsPerFormConstraint.md)
  : Create number of items per test form constraints.

- [`items_diao`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/items_diao.md)
  : Small simulated item pool example.

- [`items_lsa`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/items_lsa.md)
  : Simulated item pool example.

- [`items_mini`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/items_mini.md)
  : Small simulated item pool example.

- [`items_pilot`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/items_pilot.md)
  : Small simulated item pool example.

- [`items_vera`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/items_vera.md)
  : Small artificial item pool example.

- [`matrixExclusionTuples()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/matrixExclusionTuples.md)
  : Create item exclusion tuples from matrix.

- [`maxObjective()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/maxObjective.md)
  : Max Constraint.

- [`maximinObjective()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/maximinObjective.md)
  : Maximin Constraint.

- [`minObjective()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/minObjective.md)
  : Min Constraint.

- [`minimaxObjective()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/minimaxObjective.md)
  : Minimax Constraint.

- [`stemInclusionTuples()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/stemInclusionTuples.md)
  : Create item inclusion tuples from item stem.

- [`useSolver()`](https://beckerbenj.github.io/eatATA/reference/useSolver.md)
  : Use a solver for a list of constraints.
